abstract: I.B.M. plans to build a $360-million data center in North Carolina and another big one in Tokyo, both for delivering cloud computing services to corporate customers. This follows an announcement of a joint cloud research program from Yahoo, Hewlett-Packard and Intel on Tuesday.
snippet: I.B.M. plans to build a $360-million data center in North Carolina and another big one in Tokyo, both for delivering cloud computing services to corporate customers. This follows an announcement of a joint cloud research program from Yahoo, Hewlet...
lead_paragraph: Hardly a day goes by, it seems, without some announcement of a new “cloud computing” offering or initiative.
